byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Aurelian Breeden from Paris; Alison Smale from Berlin; Raphael Minder from Barcelona, Spain; and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and NICOLA CLARK

abstract: French prosecutors say Andreas Lubitz, co-pilot on fatal Germanwings Flight 9525, locked pilot out of cockpit and deliberately crashed plane; draw conclusion after examination of voice recorder that revealed pleading, screams and violent pounding as pilot tried to get Lubitz to open cabin door; transponder data indicates that Lubitz reset autopilot to lowest possible altitude, causing plane to strike mountainside.
lead_paragraph: The co-pilot initiated the plane’s descent for unknown reasons while he was alone in the cockpit, having locked the pilot out, said the prosecutor.

headline.main: Fatal Descent of Germanwings Plane Was ‘Deliberate,’ French Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Fatal Descent of Plane Was a ‘Deliberate Act,’ French Authorities Say

snippet: The co-pilot initiated the plane’s descent for unknown reasons while he was alone in the cockpit, having locked the pilot out, said the prosecutor.
